member.name: M:Rephidock.GeneralUtilities.Maths.MoreMath.TabShift(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: For a given 0-based column position of a tab character ('\t') returns a column position for the next character.

summary.para: Returns (the positive) value mod modulo. Keep in mind that % is the remainder operation. The result of this function is always positive or zero, as opposed to remainder.

Example differences:
-1 % 6 = -1 -but- -1 mod 6 = 5
-5 % 3 = -2 -but- -5 mod 3 = 1

member.name: M:Rephidock.GeneralUtilities.Maths.MoreMath.Wrap(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Wraps value into given range: values below the range are wrapped into it from the end and values above are wrapped into it from the start
Can be thought of as a generilized version of PosMod, as x.Wrap(0, y) returns the same result as x.PosMod(y)

member.param: The start of the range, inclusive
The end of the range, exclusive
member.remarks: If is greater than , the values are swapped. If and are equal, is returned.
member.returns: The value wrapped to be inside the range

member.summary: Calculates the digital root of a number. Digital root is calculated by taking the sum of all of the number's digits, and then that sum, until the result is a single digit.

The base of the returned number

The resulting array can be larger if there are not enough digits.

The base of the returned number
member.exception: Resulting value is too big for a

summary.para: Enumerates all positive numbers in an arbitrary base up to a given digit length, returning arrays of digits in that base, units place last.
Starts with array of zeros. Digit at the end of the array is incremented first.

member.param: The base of the counter (exclusive maxim value of individual digits)
The number of the digits in the counter
member.exception: is smaller than 2 or is smaller than 1

member.name: M:Rephidock.GeneralUtilities.Reflection.ReflectionExtensions.IsSubclassOrSelfOf(System.Type,System.Type)

summary.para: Returns true if the given is or a subclass of it.
Also supports generic type definitions. Does not support interfaces.
(net framework 3.5) Does not support enums.

member.remarks: For array types return true only on type equality.

member.name: M:Rephidock.GeneralUtilities.Reflection.ReflectionExtensions.IsOverride(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Returns true if given 's base definition is not in its declaring type (because the method is an override).
member.remarks: Note that implementations of interface methods are not overrides, but implementation of abstract methods are.
